result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Langer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $443 DOC Collect;  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Allow Animal Control onto property to inspect animals and monitor their status
State may petition to return to court and argue to seize animals if appropriate

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Langer

records.addlTxt: Defendant John M Langer in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court Orders: Sentence withheld: 1 year Probation with conditions: Allow Animal Control onto property to inspect animals and monitor their status; State may petition to return to court and argue to seize animals, if appropriate; $443 costs DOC Collect; 0 days credit
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John M Langer in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions to be filed by 4-15-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant John M Langer in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NGP set jury trial.
Deputy B. Stoikes may check on animals periodically throughout this case.
